segment.source: MD Conversion - Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: The managed browser is a web browsing application that you can deploy in your organization using .
segment.target: The managed browser is a web browsing application that you can deploy in your organization using .

segment.source: A managed browser policy configures an allow list or a block list that restricts the web sites that users of the managed browser can visit.
segment.target: A managed browser policy configures an allow list or a block list that restricts the web sites that users of the managed browser can visit.

segment.source: Because this app is a managed app, you can also apply mobile application management policies to the app, such as controlling the use of cut, copy and paste, preventing screen captures, and also ensuring that links to content that users click only open in other managed apps.
segment.target: Because this app is a managed app, you can also apply mobile application management policies to the app, such as controlling the use of cut, copy and paste, preventing screen captures, and also ensuring that links to content that users click only open in other managed apps.

segment.source: For details, see Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console.
segment.target: For details, see Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console.

segment.source: If users install the managed browser themselves on an iOS device with a version less than iOS 9, it will not be managed by any policies you create.
segment.target: If users install the managed browser themselves on an iOS device with a version less than iOS 9, it will not be managed by any policies you create.

segment.source: To ensure that the browser is managed by , they must uninstall the app before you can deploy it to them as a managed app.
segment.target: To ensure that the browser is managed by , they must uninstall the app before you can deploy it to them as a managed app.

segment.source: On iOS 9 and later, if the user installs the managed browser themselves they will be prompted to allow it to become managed by policy.
segment.target: On iOS 9 and later, if the user installs the managed browser themselves they will be prompted to allow it to become managed by policy.

segment.source: You can create managed browser policies for the following device types:
segment.target: You can create managed browser policies for the following device types:

segment.source: Devices that run Android 4 and later
segment.target: Devices that run Android 4 and later

segment.source: Devices that run iOS 7.1 and later
segment.target: Devices that run iOS 7.1 and later

segment.source: The Managed Browser supports opening web content from Microsoft apps you can use with Microsoft Intune mobile application management policies.
segment.target: The Managed Browser supports opening web content from Microsoft apps you can use with Microsoft Intune mobile application management policies.

segment.source: Create a managed browser policy
segment.target: Create a managed browser policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure one of the following Software policy types:
segment.target: Configure one of the following Software policy types:

segment.source: Managed Browser Policy (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Managed Browser Policy (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: Managed Browser Policy (iOS 7.1 and later)
segment.target: Managed Browser Policy (iOS 7.1 and later)

segment.source: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.
segment.target: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure the managed browser policy settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure the managed browser policy settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the managed browser policy to help you identify it in the console.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the managed browser policy to help you identify it in the console.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the managed browser policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the managed browser policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Enable an allow list or block list to restrict the URLs the Managed Browser can open
segment.target: Enable an allow list or block list to restrict the URLs the Managed Browser can open

segment.source: Select one of the following options:
segment.target: Select one of the following options:

segment.source: Allow the managed browser to open only the URLs listed below – Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser can open.
segment.target: Allow the managed browser to open only the URLs listed below – Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser can open.

segment.source: Block the managed browser from opening the URLs listed below – Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser will be blocked from opening.
segment.target: Block the managed browser from opening the URLs listed below – Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser will be blocked from opening.

segment.source: For more information about the URL formats you can specify, see URL format for allowed and blocked URLs in this topic.
segment.target: For more information about the URL formats you can specify, see URL format for allowed and blocked URLs in this topic.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Create a software deployment for the managed browser app
segment.target: Create a software deployment for the managed browser app

segment.source: After you have created the managed browser policy, you can then create a software deployment for the managed browser app, and associate it with the managed browser policy you created.
segment.target: After you have created the managed browser policy, you can then create a software deployment for the managed browser app, and associate it with the managed browser policy you created.

segment.source: Managed browser policies are not deployed in the same way as other polices.
segment.target: Managed browser policies are not deployed in the same way as other polices.

segment.source: This type of policy must be associated with the managed browser software package.
segment.target: This type of policy must be associated with the managed browser software package.

segment.source: Deploy the app, ensuring that you select the managed browser policy on the Mobile App Management page to associate the policy with the app.
segment.target: Deploy the app, ensuring that you select the managed browser policy on the Mobile App Management page to associate the policy with the app.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy apps, see Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune - deleted.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy apps, see Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune - deleted.

segment.source: Security and privacy for the managed browser
segment.target: Security and privacy for the managed browser

segment.source: On iOS devices, web sites that users visit that have an expired or untrusted certificate cannot be opened.
segment.target: On iOS devices, web sites that users visit that have an expired or untrusted certificate cannot be opened.

segment.source: Settings that users make for the built-in browser on their devices are not used by the managed browser.
segment.target: Settings that users make for the built-in browser on their devices are not used by the managed browser.

segment.source: This is because the managed browser does not have access to these settings.
segment.target: This is because the managed browser does not have access to these settings.

segment.source: If you configure the options Require simple PIN for access or Require corporate credentials for access in a mobile application management policy associated with the managed browser and a user clicks the help link on the authentication page, they can then browse any Internet sites regardless of whether they were added to a block list in the managed browser policy.
segment.target: If you configure the options Require simple PIN for access or Require corporate credentials for access in a mobile application management policy associated with the managed browser and a user clicks the help link on the authentication page, they can then browse any Internet sites regardless of whether they were added to a block list in the managed browser policy.

segment.source: The managed browser can only block access to sites when they are accessed directly.
segment.target: The managed browser can only block access to sites when they are accessed directly.

segment.source: It cannot block access when intermediate services (such as a translation service) are used to access the site.
segment.target: It cannot block access when intermediate services (such as a translation service) are used to access the site.

segment.source: To allow authentication, and to ensure that documentation can be accessed,*.microsoft.com is exempt from the allow or block list settings – it is always allowed.
segment.target: To allow authentication, and to ensure that documentation can be accessed,*.microsoft.com is exempt from the allow or block list settings – it is always allowed.

segment.source: Turn off usage data
segment.target: Turn off usage data

segment.source: Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the performance and use of the managed browser to improve Microsoft products and services, but users can turn off data collection by using the Usage Data setting on their device.
segment.target: Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the performance and use of the managed browser to improve Microsoft products and services, but users can turn off data collection by using the Usage Data setting on their device.

segment.source: You have no control over the collection of this data.
segment.target: You have no control over the collection of this data.

segment.source: Reference information
segment.target: Reference information

segment.source: URL format for allowed and blocked URLs
segment.target: URL format for allowed and blocked URLs

segment.source: Use the following information to learn about the allowed formats and wildcards you can use when specifying URLs in the allowed and blocked lists.
segment.target: Use the following information to learn about the allowed formats and wildcards you can use when specifying URLs in the allowed and blocked lists.

segment.source: You can use the wildcard symbol ‘*’ according to the rules in the permitted patterns list below.
segment.target: You can use the wildcard symbol ‘*’ according to the rules in the permitted patterns list below.

segment.source: Ensure that you prefix all URLs with http or https when entering them into the list.
segment.target: Ensure that you prefix all URLs with http or https when entering them into the list.

segment.source: You can specify port numbers in the address.
segment.target: You can specify port numbers in the address.

segment.source: If you do not specify a port number, the values used will be:
segment.target: If you do not specify a port number, the values used will be:

segment.source: Port 80 for http
segment.target: Port 80 for http

segment.source: Port 443 for https
segment.target: Port 443 for https

segment.source: Using wildcards for the port number is not supported, for example, http://www.contoso.com:* and http://www.contoso.com: /*
segment.target: Using wildcards for the port number is not supported, for example, http://www.contoso.com:* and http://www.contoso.com: /*

segment.source: Use the following table to learn about the permitted patterns you can use when you specify URLs:
segment.target: Use the following table to learn about the permitted patterns you can use when you specify URLs:

segment.target: URL

segment.target: Description

segment.target: Matches

segment.source: How conflicts between the allow and block list are resolved
segment.target: How conflicts between the allow and block list are resolved

segment.source: If multiple managed browser policies are deployed to a device and the settings conflict, both the mode (allow or block) and the URL lists are evaluated for conflicts.
segment.target: If multiple managed browser policies are deployed to a device and the settings conflict, both the mode (allow or block) and the URL lists are evaluated for conflicts.

segment.source: In case of a conflict, the following behavior applies:
segment.target: In case of a conflict, the following behavior applies:

segment.source: If the modes in each policy are the same, but the URL lists are different, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.
segment.target: If the modes in each policy are the same, but the URL lists are different, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.

segment.source: If the modes in each policy are different, but the URL lists are the same, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.
segment.target: If the modes in each policy are different, but the URL lists are the same, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.

segment.source: If a device is receiving managed browser policies for the first time and two policies conflict, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.
segment.target: If a device is receiving managed browser policies for the first time and two policies conflict, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.

segment.source: Use the Policy Conflicts node of the Policy workspace to view the conflicts.
segment.target: Use the Policy Conflicts node of the Policy workspace to view the conflicts.

segment.source: If a device has already received a managed browser policy and a second policy is deployed with conflicting settings, the original settings remain on the device.
segment.target: If a device has already received a managed browser policy and a second policy is deployed with conflicting settings, the original settings remain on the device.

segment.source: Use the Policy Conflicts node of the Policy workspace to view the conflicts.
segment.target: Use the Policy Conflicts node of the Policy workspace to view the conflicts.
